intro: Houssayanthus incanus, commonly known as the woolly houssayanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
